	}

	@font-face {
		font-family: 'Segoe UI';

	}

wa-sectionHero wa-sectionHero-pricing"> <div class="wa-content wa-content-4up"> <h1>Azure Storage Pricing</h1> <div class="wa-spacer wa-spacer-3down"> <h3>Reliable, economical cloud storage for data big and small.</h3> <a data-event-property="storage top CTA" data-event="pricingdetails-clicked-primarycta" href="/en-us/free/" class="wa-button wa-button-primary">Try for free</a> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro wa-content-4up"> <div class="wa-spacer"> <a href="/en-us/services/storage/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-light">Storage Overview</a> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <a href="/en-us/documentation/services/storage/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-light">Documentation</a> </div> <span class="icon icon-l"><svg><use xlink:href="#storage" viewBox="0 0 67.019 57.145"/></svg></span> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section wa-section-mini wa-section-W06"> <div class="wa-content wa-content-4up"> <h2>How Azure pricing works</h2> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList- wa-checkList-green-white"> <li><strong>No</strong> upfront cost</li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList wa-checkList-green-white"> <li><strong>No</strong> termination fees</li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-spacer"> <ul class="wa-checkList wa-checkList wa-checkList-green-white"> <li>Pay only for what you use</li> </ul> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro wa-content-divided"> <a href="/en-us/pricing/" class="wa-arrowLink wa-arrowLink-light">Learn more about Azure pricing</a> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section"> <div class="wa-content"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>Earn discounts on Azure services with a prepaid 12-month subscription. <a href="/en-us/offers/ms-azr-0026p/">Learn more</a>.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <p>Azure has four types of storageâ€”Block blobs, Page Blobs and Disks, Tables and Queues, and Files. <a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/">See how they work</a></p> <p>Your total cost depends on how much you store, the volume of storage transactions and <a href="/en-us/pricing/details/data-transfers/">outbound data transfers</a>, and which data redundancy option you choose. Hereâ€™s how they compare:</p> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <table> <thead> <tr> <th></th> <th>Locally Redundant Storage (LRS)</th> <th>Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS)</th> <th>Geographically Redundant Storage (GRS)</th> <th>Read-Access Geographically Redundant Storage (RA-GRS)</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>How it works</td> <td>Makes multiple synchronous copies of your data within a single datacenter</td> <td>Stores three copies of data across multiple datacenters within or across regions. For block blobs only.</td> <td>Same as LRS, plus multiple asynchronous copies to a second datacenter hundreds of miles away</td> <td>Same as GRS, plus read access to the secondary datacenter</td> </tr> <tr> <td>Total copies</td> <td class="align-c numeric">3</td> <td class="align-c numeric">3</td> <td class="align-c numeric">6</td> <td class="align-c numeric">6</td> </tr> <tr> <td>Why use it</td> <td>For economical local storage or data governance compliance</td> <td>An economical, higher durability option for block blob storage</td> <td>For protection against a major datacenter outage or disaster</td> <td>Provides read access to data during an outage, for maximum data availability and durability</td> </tr> <tr> <td>Availability SLA</td> <td>99.9% read/write</td> <td>99.9% read/write</td> <td>99.9% read/write</td> <td> 99.9% write <br/> 99.99% read </td> </tr> </tbody> </table> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <h2>Pricing Details</h2> <div class="wa-dropdownList"> <div> <label for="wa-dropdown-region">Region:</label> <div class="wa-dropdown-container wa-dropdown-medium"> <select id="wa-dropdown-region" class="wa-dropdown wa-dropdown-region" data-control="dropdown"> charge <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.0036'>$0.0036</span> per 100,000 transactions for Block Blobs. Transactions include both read and write operations to storage.</p> </caption> </table> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west brazil-south us-east-2 us-central australia-east australia-southeast"> <h3>File Storage</h3> <p>File Storage is now generally available. It uses industry standard SMB 3.0 protocol. Share files between applications running in your virtual machines using familiar Windows APIs or File REST API. </p> <p>The per GB prices below will be effective starting June 1, 2016. A promotional 50% discount will continue to be applied through May 31, 2016.</p> <p><a class="wa-arrowLink" href="http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2014/05/12/introducing-microsoft-azure-file-service.aspx">Learn more</a></p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>LRS</th> <th>GRS</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount='{"default":0.08,"regional":{"brazil-south":0.109,"australia-east":0.088,"australia-southeast":0.088,"central-india":0.088,"south-india":0.0792,"west-india":0.1012,"usgov-virginia":0.1,"usgov-iowa":0.1}}'>$0.08</span> per GB</td> <td><span class="price-data " data-amount='{"default":0.1,"regional":{"brazil-south":0.136,"australia-east":0.11,"australia-southeast":0.11,"central-india":0.11,"south-india":0.099,"west-india":0.1265,"usgov-virginia":0.125,"usgov-iowa":0.125}}'>$0.1</span> per GB</td> </tr> </tbody> <caption> <span class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="australia-east australia-southeast"> The Australia Regions are available to customers with a business presence in Australia or New Zealand. </span> </caption> <caption> <p>Starting on June 1, 2016, File Storage read operations will be charged at <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.015'>$0.015</span> per 100,000 operations for both LRS and GRS accounts. File Storage write operations will be charged at <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.15'>$0.15</span> per 100,000 operations for LRS accounts and <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.3'>$0.3</span> per 100,000 operations for GRS accounts. The promotional price of <span class="price-data " data-amount='0.0036'>$0.0036</span> per 100,000 read and write operations for both LRS and GRS accounts will be effective through May 31, 2016.</p> </caption> </table> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast blobs are ideal for VHD images.</p> <p><a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/" class="wa-arrowLink">Learn more</a></p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Storage Queues provide a reliable messaging solution for your apps.</p> <p><a href="https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/storage-introduction/" class="wa-arrowLink">Learn more</a></p> Monthly plan rates for Storage are based on the Pay-As-You-Go base tier. The actual price depends on commitment length, amount spent, and billing option.</p> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <h3>Import/Export</h3> <p>Transfer large amounts of data to and from Azure using hard disk drives. <a href="/en-us/pricing/details/storage-import-export/">Learn more</a></p> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-north-central us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west brazil-south us-east-2 us-central australia-east australia-southeast"> <h2>Premium Storage</h2> <p>Premium Storage is high performance Solid State Drive (SSD) based Storage designed to support I/O intensive workloads with significantly high throughput and low latency. With Premium Storage, you can provision a persistent disk and configure its size and performance characteristics to meet your application requirements.</p> <div class="wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-east us-west us-south-central europe-north europe-west asia-pacific-southeast asia-pacific-east japan-east japan-west us-east-2 us-central australia-east australia-southeast"> <h3>Page Blobs &amp; Disks</h3> <p>Page Blob Premium Storage is currently offered in three disk sizes: P10 (128 GB), P20 (512 GB) and P30 (1,024 GB). These disk sizes provide different input/output operations per sec (IOPs), throughput caps and monthly price per GB, offering simplicity and better price predictability. You choose the option which best meets your required storage size, IOPs, and throughput for your applications. You can attach several persistent disks to a VM and configure up to 64 TB of storage per VM, and achieve 80,000 (input/output operations per second) and 1600 MB per second disk throughput per VM at less than one millisecond latency for read operations. Premium Storage is supported by a new a variant of the D-series and G-series sizes called â€œDSâ€ and â€œGSâ€ respectively, which are specifically targeted for Premium Storage. The pricing and billing meters for the DS sizes are the same as D-series and the GS sizes are the same as G-series.</p> <p>Snapshots are charged at <span class="price-data " data-amount='{"default":0.12,"regional":{"us-east-2":0.12,"us-west":0.132,"us-central":0.132,"europe-west":0.145,"europe-north":0.132,"asia-pacific-southeast":0.132,"japan-east":0.152,"japan-west":0.138,"australia-east":0.132,"australia-southeast":0.132,"asia-pacific-east":0.145}}'>$0.12</span>/GB per month.</p> <table> <thead> <tr> <th>Disk Types</th> <th>P10</th> <th>P20</th> <th>P30</th> </tr> </thead> <tbody> <tr> <td>Disk Size</td> <td>128 GB</td> <td>512 GB</td> <td>1,024 GB</td> </tr> <tr> <td>Price per month</td> <td><span class="price-data " <td><span class="price-data " data-amount='{"default":66.56,"regional":{"us-east":73.22,"us-east-2":66.56,"us-west":73.22,"us-central":73.22,"europe-west":80.54,"europe-north":73.22,"asia-pacific-southeast":73.22,"japan-east":84.2,"japan-west":76.54,"australia-east":73.22,"australia-southeast":73.22,"asia-pacific-east":80.54}}'>$66.56</span></td> </tbody> <caption> <p>There are no storage transaction charges for Premium Storage.</p> </caption> </table> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="us-north-central"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>Premium Storage is not available in the North Central US region. Please select another region.</p> <p>Premium Storage is only available in West US, East US, East US 2, Central US, US South Central, North Europe, West Europe, Southeast Asia, Japan East/West, and Australia East regions.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="brazil-south"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>Premium Storage is not available in the Brazil South region. Please select another region.</p> <p>Premium Storage is only available in West US, East US, East US 2, Central US, US South Central, North Europe, West Europe, Southeast Asia, Japan East/West, and Australia East regions.</p> </div> </div> <br/> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="central-india west-india south-india"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>The India regions are currently available to volume licensing customers and partners with a local enrollment in India. For more information, contact your Microsoft India partner manager or account manager. The India regions will open to direct online Azure subscriptions in 2016.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="usgov-virginia"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>For Azure Government pricing information, contact your Microsoft representative or reseller.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-conditionalDisplay" data-condition-region="usgov-iowa"> <div class="wa-notification"> <span class="wa-iconBoxed"><span class="icon"><svg><use xlink:href="#notification" viewBox="-2 -1 35 35"/></svg></span></span> <p>For Azure Government pricing information, contact your Microsoft representative or reseller.</p> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <h3>Support &amp; SLA</h3> <ul> <li>Free billing and subscription management support.</li> <li>Flexible support plans starting at <span class="price-data " data-amount='{"currencies":{"ARS":450.0,"AUD":40.0,"BRL":110.0,"CAD":40.0,"CHF":30.0,"DKK":200.0,"EUR":25.0,"GBP":20.0,"HKD":250.0,"IDR":430000.0,"INR":1800.0,"JPY":3000.0,"KRW":34800.0,"MXN":600.0,"MYR":150.0,"NOK":250.0,"NZD":40.0,"RUB":1900.0,"SAR":110.0,"SEK":250.0,"TRY":90.0,"TWD":900.0,"USD":29.0,"ZAR":500.0}}' data-decimals="0">$29</span>/month. <a href="/en-us/support/plans/">Shop for a plan</a></li> <li>Guaranteed 99.9% or greater availability (excludes preview services). <a href="/en-us/support/legal/sla/storage/"> Read the SLA</a></li> </ul> </div> <div class="wa-content"> <div class="wa-faq-expandAll" data-faq="faq"> <a href="#" class="expand">Expand All</a> <a href="#" class="collapse">Collapse All</a> </div> </div> <div class="wa-content wa-content-micro"> <h3>FAQ</h3> <ul class="wa-faq" data-faq="faq"> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">If I use Storage for only a few days a month, is the cost prorated?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Yes. Storage capacity is billed in units of the average daily amount of data stored, in gigabytes (GB), over a monthly period. For example, if you consistently utilized 10 GB of storage for the first half of the month and none for the second half of the month, you would be billed for your average usage of 5 GB of storage.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">How do I know which data redundancy option (LRS, GRS, RA-GRS) Iâ€™m using?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Storage accounts by default are set up to be geographically redundant. You can change these setting to read-access geographically redundant or locally redundant through the Microsoft Azure classic portal or the service management API. You can also check the status on the portal on using the service management API.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">How does RA-GRS billing work?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Storage accounts will be charged for a minimum of 30 days from the time the service is enabled. For example, if RA-GRS is turned on May 1 and turned off May 5, the storage account will be charged for RA-GRS through May 30. After that, GRS pricing would start.</p> <p>If RA-GRS is turned on May 1 and turned off June 14, RA-GRS would be charged through June 14. On June 15, GRS pricing would take effect.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">If I attach an empty 100GB disk to my virtual machine, will I be charged for the entire 100 GB or just the storage space I use?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>If the empty 100GB disk is backed by a Premium Storage Account then you will be charged for a P0 (128GB) disk. If any other type of Storage Account is used then youâ€™ll only be billed for the storage space used to store the data that is written to the disk regardless of the allocated disk size.</p> </div> </li> <li class="wa-faq-question"> <a href="#">Is Premium Storage covered under the same SLA as other storage services?</a> <div class="wa-faq-answer"> <p>Yes. 99.9% read/write availability also applies to Premium Storage accounts. </p> </div> </li> </ul> </div>; <div class="wa-content"> <h3>Resources</h3> <div class="wa-resourceBlockRow"> <a href="/en-us/pricing/calculator/?service=storage" class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Service Details</span> Learn more about Storage </a> <a href="/en-us/documentation/services/storage/" class="wa-resourceBlock"> <span class="wa-resourceBlock-header">Documentation</span> Review technical tutorials, videos and more resources </a> </div> </div> </section> <section class="wa-section wa-section-W06 wa-sectionCtaPanel">
